title: Daily reminder that Zeal items are still GROSSLY underpriced.
body:
Title.

######Maybe having two+ core items at only ~2600 gold on the hardest carry class isn't healthy. That's not even counting GA or LDR.

replies.body: Meanwhile "The AP Statikk Shiv" {{item:3285}} costs 3200 gold and is just a bad item in general

its not a bad item
if it was a bad item lit wouldnt be built
(ahem {{item:3056}} )

But what other options would you have for AP items?
Exactly, meanwhile what other options do you have for tank items

The "Ap Statikk Shiv" does not fulfill the same reason for being bought, nor the qualities, of a Zeal item. Statick is meant for waveclear, and it's multiplicative AS stat, which increases damage from ADC's, ya know, multiplicative-ly. 

Luden's was meant to be a replacement to DFG, an item that gives more damage on top of damage. Luden's primary purpose is not to add in yet even more Waveclear to Mages, but for more damage only. It's AOE is meant for teamfights, more than it is for waveclear. 

In other words, this is an ignorant comparison, only comparing 1 similar aspect of the two items/item groups.

Why? Because they're approximately less expensive than other builds?

That's not a good enough reason, because there are _way_ more factors than just "total build cost". It has to do with per-item effectiveness.

An assassin is generally effective with around _half_ of an item. Typically {{item:3134}}, although {{item:3144}} or {{item:3057}} works as well, depending on the specific champion. That's from 1050g (for someone like Fizz, who rushes Sheen for Lich Bane) to 1500g (Akali, who sometimes rushes Cutlass for Gunblade).

A mage comes online with about _one_ complete item. Nearly all of the time, it's {{item:3165}}, for 2900g. Some use {{item:3027}}, for 2700g and 6+ minutes to hit effectiveness. Enchanters do the same, except with whatever enchanter item is the meta at the time (currently Ardent, for 2300g) combined with a 500g starting item (technically 850g, but we're ignoring costs for the first part of it, as we ignore Doran's items for others) for a total of 2800g.

Note mages can still do things without these items, they just kinda suck before they have them.

Juggernauts come online with about one and a half items, typically Black Cleaver and the resistance component of their first item (Chain armor or Specter's Cowl). 3000g+800/1200g, for a total between 3800g and 4200g. Riven, Kled, and Fiora come online here, as well, and Yasuo starts to be relevant, as he gets 100% crit.

Tanks come online with around two items. Either two full defensive items, or a semi-aggressive item (Titanic or Sunfire) with a defensive one. There are a _lot_ of options for this, but it sits around 6000g. Yasuo actually becomes decently relevant here, as he completes his Infinity Edge, although he won't be teamfighting for shit yet, because he has no sustain or defense at all. Mordekaiser also becomes relevant here, or at least as relevant as he _can_ be.

Team phase starts about right now, with at least 2 outer turrets gone.

Bruisers tend become relevant with around three items, although it ranges between 2 and 4. Gunblade is a must, as well as a defensive item, combined with Rageblade, Triforce, or Titanic. This is around 9000g, because these are a _lot_ of expensive items.

Pantheon caps off about here, as well. Most assassins tend to, as well, as they have to start building defensive after their third item.

Around three and a half items is when marksmen tend to become actually important. IE, Zeal, BorK or Bloodthirster, and half of their tank-shredding item. Before, they were kept alive solely by the support. Now, they're actually able to 1v1 tanks, juggernauts, and other marksmen, as long as the opponent isn't fed, and doesn't close to them. 2600 for zeal item, 3700 for BT, 3400 for IE, and 1300g for Last Whisper, for a total of 11000g. Sure, they do damage _before_ then, but they'll still suck ass in any team fight, because they'll be killed by stray damage. Before now, the only thing keeping them alive is the support. Now, they actually become somewhat self-sufficient.

Most other champions cap off here, as well, as almost everyone takes a truly defensive item. Tanks pick up that last bit of extra durability, but it's not as important.
Marksmen really only need these two: {{item:3031}} {{item:3087}}  which is 6000 gold.

Two items? Neither of which have sustain, or any tank-killing properties?

Or any method at all to keep them alive through a fight?

Look. Just because the enemy Trist kicks your braindead Rengar's ass, because he missed _literally_ everything, including his _ult's leap_, with those two items, doesn't mean that it's enough for Trist to actually do anything to anyone _with_ a quarter of a brain.
Crit is sort of a tank-killing property. Also, who needs items with sustain when Warlord's Bloodlust and this piece of toast exist:{{item:3504}} ?

While Crit itself is pretty good, it's useless without some Armor Pen behind it. Remember that infamous video of Draven chucking like 35 axes at Poppy, and her advancing regardless? Despite his build, he had no Armor pen, and Poppy was taking very little damage.
I haven't seen the video, but I would imagine the Poppy was pretty fed or the Draven was pretty behind. I can't make any definitive statements though, because I haven't seen it.
Most need those two plus {{item:3094}}

ADCs do not die from stray damage in teamfights.  They die from being the target of at least two enemies during teamfights, and those two enemies may hit other enemies with stray damage.

Even in the beginning of the mid-game, adcs have significant enough of dps to be a threat in a teamfight, especially once their mage/assassin has blown their cooldowns.  They also have that enchanter support that, as you said, came online pretty early to keep them safe and deal more damage (at least currently).

Sure ADCs need what you mentioned to be able to 1v1, but they're never in a 1v1.  Even with even numbers in a fight, they deal enough damage that they can't be ignored and are durable enough to not fall over from just stray damage (especially with a dedicated sup).

Unless the ADC has Last Whisper, or is _very_ fed, they're not even _scratching_ a tank.

And it's insanely easy to kill an ADC before they have sustain. Afterwords, it's only a minor difficulty. But until they can actually sustain, they won't be surviving any fight greater than a 3v3 under their own turret. That's part of the reason we have supports babysit them, so that they can actually keep the marksman alive long enough to miss 90% of their CS anyways.
You still have to damage the adc though.  Don't pretend there are spells the size of Ziggs's ult flying around teamfights just hitting everyone.

Your hypothetical marksmen build is nothing like what is currently being built. The current build path for ADCs is {{item:1038}} first, finish a {{item:3086}} item, finish {{item:3508}} or {{item:3031}}, finish another {{item:3086}} with tier 2 boots thrown in there somewhere. 
That comes out to 9700g which is very comparable to the meta 
mage ({{item:3165}} + {{item:3151}} + {{item:3135}} + {{item:3020}} = 9750g) and 
tank ({{item:3065}}/{{item:3001}} + {{item:3742}}/{{item:3143}}/{{item:3068}} + {{item:3193}}/{{item:3083}} + tier 2 boots = 9400/9750g) 
3 item spikes. 

Looking at 2 item spikes we again see that marksmen's builds are similarly priced to other roles with {{item:3031}} + completed {{item:3086}} item = 6000g, {{item:3165}} + {{item:3151}} = 6000g, and {{item:3065}} + {{item:3143}}  = 5700g. The only time that marksmen are noticeably weaker than other roles is after 1 item is completed but before 2 items are completed, but that only accounts for about 5-6 minutes of the game.

...Have you actually even seen a marksman?

Have you actually ever seen a marksman fighting? They have almost no chance against a burst champion, they lose to nearly every DPS champion until they have sustain, and they can't even scratch a tank until they at least have Last Whisper.

You also listed only three items. ***If you compare only price to total items, marksmen come out ahead***, you're right, there.

***However, marksmen need more items than other classes to actually do anything***. As Ahri, I can get by with a Morellonomicon to get kills. Gunblade just means I can pop most squishies. Shen, I get by once I get Titanic and a true defensive item. Akali, I can start racking up kills as soon as I have Cutlass and level 6. Diana, Abyssal mask is all I need. Sona? I just need whatever mana regeneration item is the most meta one - Athene's, Redemption, or Ardent.

Ashe? BorK, Hurricane, IE, and Last Whisper

Xayah? Essence Reaver, Death's Dance, Shiv/Hurricane, Last Whisper

Cait? IE, RFC, Bloodthirster, Last Whisper.

...Seeing a pattern? The only champion I need a comparable number of items on is Mordekaiser. _Fucking **Mordekaiser**_.

Did you even read my post? I understand that other classes peak harder than marksmen between 1 and 2 items, but past 2 items, marksmen are as or more effective than other classes. With zerkers, IE, and a zeal item, an ADC can easily have 1.2 AS, 140 AD, and 30% crit chance which gives ~260 dps to the target dummy. Comparatively, taking into account the additional burn due to the dummy having 10k hp, a mage (specifically Syndra) with morellos, liandries, and sorcs will only do about ~250 dps to the target dummy. So at literally 2 items, a marksmen already has more damage potential than a mage.

Moreover, if you are building a life-steal item as your third item as any ADC right now, you deserve to lose. With how strong tanks are right now, how weak assassins/divers are, and the prevalence of shielding supports with ardent censor, ADCs don't need to build defensively at all right now.
Yeah I just realized that like half of adc's core item choices are under 3k gold.
They usually end up with 4 or 5 items under 3k if you count boots.
Which sounds bad until you realize that the same is true of every class in the game.

And support itemization because they're budget items?

That's a lot different from the AFK farming class having 4-5 items being ~2600g or less.
Zeal upgrades (not Zeal itself, though) should probably be more towards the 2800 to 3000 gold range (without major increases in stats, too).

DING DING DING.

WE HAVE A WINNER.

ADC items should be ~80% gold efficient due to their multiplicative scaling and lack of downtime, relative to other classes. Not close to 100% gold efficient.

Its possible AD and AS is underpriced in general, considering the performance of assassins and on-hit champions any time they're viable.
Just PD alone should be 3200.

Marksmans items cost about 15000+ in total 
Mage items cost about 16000+ in total
Fighter items cost about 15000+ in total.

The differences aren't all that much in total but what is important is a couple of things. The total value of these items, on average Marksmans have a waaay better spread of gold across their items rather than a lot of up front gold pre-item. The marksman class also generates the most gold on average as they are the most gold reliant class so their items will typically come faster if the marksman is farming properly. The final issue is the Marksman class has some of the best and most gold efficient items out of all classes. Marksmans are a class that scale with items yet they will on average get full build way faster than other classes. Why on earth they have such powerful items that all come to them cheaper on average while having the highest gold income is just freaking dumb. Please fix this bullshit item favoritism.

Let's be realistic here, since the '15000' doesn't really accurately convey anything.

A marksman's end-build is around 14700.  {{item:3031}} {{item:3094}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3026}} {{item:3036}} {{item:3006}} 

A fighter's 5 item build is around 13300. {{item:3071}} {{item:3748}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3047}}. A 6th item would have to cost 1400 in order to break even with an ADC's gold cost. The options range from 2400 {{item:3026}}  to 3600 {{item:3139}}.

If you use {{item:3078}} instead of {{item:3071}}, tack another 733g on there. 

That means you're spending anywhere between 1000g (1733 for TF) and 2600g (3333 for TF) more than the ADC...for much less effect.
